decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Treasure Cruise and Consider to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for powerful attacks. It also includes cards like Picklock Prankster and Lightning Axe for removal and disruption, while maintaining card advantage through spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, utilizing cheap spells and creatures to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to establish their game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Greasefang Parhelion combo, using cards such as Guardian of New Benalia and Sheltered by Ghosts to protect your key pieces. The deck also includes disruption through Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the game. The combo pieces, Greasefang and Parhelion II, will allow you to generate immense value and overwhelm your opponent. Additionally, the deck utilizes lands like The Mycosynth Gardens and Monument to Endurance to support the combo and maintain advantage throughout the game.

This deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo by quickly finding and playing the necessary pieces. It includes support cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's board while setting up the combo. The deck also includes various lands to ensure the right mana base and to provide additional utility. The strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with the power of Greasefang Parhelion.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and generate significant advantage. The deck contains cards that support the combo, protect it, and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By efficiently assembling the combo pieces and optimally utilizing the resources available, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory in the Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on quickly casting spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard, constantly pressuring the opponent with aggressive plays. The key strategy is to efficiently fill the graveyard with instants and sorceries, allowing for the repeated resurrection of Arclight Phoenix to deal damage and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a mix of cantrips, removal spells, and card draw to enable this strategy, aiming to close out games quickly with a combination of damage from Arclight Phoenix and other aggressive creatures.

The main concept of the Boros Aggro deck is to quickly deploy low-cost creatures like Ornithopter, Novice Inspector, and Cori-Steel Cutter to apply early pressure on the opponent. With efficient removal spells like Gleeful Demolition and Voldaren Epicure, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while continuing to attack aggressively with creatures like Knight-Errant of Eos and Venerated Loxodon. The deck also includes some utility lands like Eiganjo, Seat of the Empire and Shefet Dunes to provide additional value and flexibility in combat. Overall, the deck focuses on being fast and proactive in the early game to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo by using cards like Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II. The strategy involves protecting key pieces with cards like Sheltered by Ghosts and Seasoned Hallowblade, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with powerful synergies and efficient interaction.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy, overwhelming opponents with a combination of efficient creatures and powerful artifact enchantments like Ensoul Artifact. By using cards like Spyglass Siren and Shrapnel Blast, the deck can quickly deal damage to the opponent's creatures and life total, while also utilizing counter spells like Metallic Rebuke to protect its own board state. With a mix of high-powered creatures and versatile spells, the deck aims to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The deck revolves around assembling a powerful combo involving Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II, supported by cards like Monument to Endurance and Guardian of New Benalia. The strategy involves using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board while setting up the combo. The deck also includes a variety of lands to provide mana fixing and support for the combo pieces. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to effectively and efficiently execute the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells, focusing on dealing direct damage to the opponent's life total. The creatures in the deck possess abilities that can further enhance their damage output, while the burn spells provide additional reach and removal for opposing threats. The deck is designed to quickly close out games through a combination of creature attacks and direct damage spells, making it a fast and efficient choice for players looking to win through relentless aggression.

This Boros Aggro deck is focused on equipping creatures with powerful equipment and quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive threats. The deck includes a variety of equipment cards to boost the creatures' power and toughness, as well as cards that allow for quick creature deployment and protection. By combining efficient creatures with strong equipment, this deck aims to deal significant damage early in the game and maintain pressure on the opponent throughout the match.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent with fast and efficient creatures and spells. By utilizing cards like Reckless Bushwhacker, Thraben Inspector, and Warden of the Inner Sky, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and aggressively. Portable Hole can help deal with opposing threats, and Cosmogrand Zenith provides a strong finisher. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy by providing access to white and red mana sources for the deck's spells and abilities.

The main concept of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Lotus Field, then assemble the combo pieces such as Scapeshift and The Wandering Minstrel to win the game. The deck also includes cards like Stock Up and Impulse for card selection and Boseiju, Who Endures for protection. The goal is to generate a large amount of mana, trigger powerful effects like Lumra, Bellow of the Woods, and potentially win with Thassa's Oracle or overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures. The key strategy involves ramping up mana with cards like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, while disrupting the opponent's tempo with cards like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Collected Company is used to bring out multiple threats at once, complementing the aggressive nature of the deck. Skyclave Apparition helps to deal with opposing threats, while cards like Knight of Autumn provide versatility for different situations. The deck aims to win the game through early aggression and efficient creature interactions.

The deck focuses on putting constant pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total through a combination of fast creatures like Robber of the Rich and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, backed up by direct damage spells like Lightning Strike and Burst Lightning. The deck also utilizes cards like Monstrous Rage and Reckless Rage to give its creatures additional power and remove any blockers that may stand in its way. With a low mana curve and a focus on efficient threats, this deck looks to win fast and decisively.

This UW Control deck focuses on slowing down the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells, while generating card advantage through cards like Consult the Star Charts and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer to control the board and win the game. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds an additional threat to the deck. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a slower, more controlling matchup.
